commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Hey, come to think of it... Has there been any response to our website?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: C'mon, you think I'm an amateur? I've been keeping it regularly updated so the page views are through the roof!

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: We've got all of your daily posts to thank for that.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: I've been looking forward to your daily posts as well. You come up with so many different topics!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Spoken like a true fan, Emma! You're so right. I've got so much content, it's comin' out of my ears!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: There's no point having a website if no one visits it, right? Even an amateur knows you gotta work hard to keep your visitors entertained!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: You never miss a beat when it comes to these things, do you, Nico-chi?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: If only you were that passionate about your studies...

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: W-Well, we're not talking about those right now!

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: Hahaha... In any case, yes. We're getting a response.

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: We've got so many supportive messages coming in!

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Really? Boy, that's a relief... I was worried what people might think, given that this event was officially canceled before...

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: We're getting a large response, but that doesn't mean we can just rest on our laurels.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Why? Is there some kind of problem?

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: People are being mostly supportive, but there are also some messages of concern coming through too.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: R-Really? What kinds of things are they saying?

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Actually, don't tell me. I'm too scared to know.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: No, we can't just sweep it under the rug. If there are improvements to be made, then we have to make them.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: So, precisely what kind of opinions are we talking about here?

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Hmm. Well, to put it simply, a lot of them just want to know what sort of event the School Idol Festival will even be.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: So we are not explaining what the event entails well enough?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: It'd be way quicker if you just looked at the messages yourself.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Here, have a look.

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Let's see... "The 'Come Together, Dream Together!' slogan sounds like a lot of fun, but what kind of event is this exactly?"

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: There are a few messages saying the same thing.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: So then the meaning of the slogan isn't getting through to them...?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I don't quite understand what they aren't getting...

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: It just means we're not conveying our message properly.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Maybe our wording was too abstract?

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: I thought they'd at least get the feeling behind it...

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Exactly. It just exudes excitement!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: While I agree with you, Yoshiko, it may be that feelings alone are not tangible enough to suffice.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Argh, Shizuku! It's Yohane! YO-HA-NE!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: R-Right...

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: It doesn't matter how good we think it is. If the people who might be interested don't understand it, there's no point.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: So does that mean we have to come up with a new slogan? I think the one we have is perfect as-is...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: No, I don't think we need to change our slogan.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: I also think we should leave it as it is.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Then what do we do to get our message across?

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: We gotta think of a way to help everyone understand.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: But how?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: I know! We don't have to think too hard about it. We just gotta do what we usually do!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Yeah, exactly! Honoka's totally right!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: But what do you mean?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: What do we normally do?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Quit being cryptic and spit it out already!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You're talking about making a promotional video, right?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Exactamundo!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We should come up with a promo video to promote the event. The same way we do when we're showing off our new songs!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: O-Ohhh, of course! A promo video, huh? That's way better than trying to awkwardly explain the slogan. I didn't think it was THAT run-of-the-mill.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: Oh please, you had no clue.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: I had all the clues!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: That makes sense. We can explain what our motivations are and how we plan to make this fun for everyone in a video.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Yeah! Let's make a promo video filled with all of our hopes and plans for the event!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: All of our hopes and plans? If we're showing them our plans, why don't we just show everyone how we're preparing for it?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Oh, that's perfect! Let's go with Setsuna's idea and film some behind-the-scenes prep work!

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: After seeing how much fun we're having working on the event, everyone else will want to join in too!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: After all, fun is infectious, right?

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Let us show everyone how we feel. Let us show them how we make our dreams a reality.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: All right! If we're all in agreement, then let's get filming!
